text.__SUMMARY__: Asparagus lignosus  ("Katdoring") is a thorny, spindly creeper of the Asparagus genus, that is indigenous to the south-western Cape of South Africa.It occurs in rocky sandstone slopes and fynbos vegetation in the Western Cape.
text.Further reading: Pink, A. (2004). Gardening for the Million. Project Gutenberg Literary Archive Foundation.
